reviewText: In Season 1.1 we had 3 big, multi-part stories, and a few single episodes. Here in Season 1.2 it's mainly single, self-contained episodes, and an info-giving featurette.Season 1.2 continues the excellence of the series. We do actually get a couple of 2-part stories here, and we see more detail & characterization being added. Cover Girl appears quite a bit, which is nice, since I mainly remember Scarlet & Lady Jaye. She's also the only one of the 3 who doesn't entirely shoot down Shipwreck's advances. :) G.I. Joe has great characters & action.A few highlights...- Twenty Questions: A TV investigator slams G.I. Joe as being a rip-off of government resources. Shipwreck takes him on a wild ride to show him the reality of life in true action.- The Synthoid Conspiracy, 2-parts: Cobra infiltrates G.I. Joe with synthetic imitations of real people. The Joes tackle the conspiracy with the help of a surprising ally.- Lights! Cameras! Cobra!: A filmmaker recruits real Joes for his G.I. Joe movie, and Cobra appears and makes it highly realistic.- Battle For The Train Of Gold: Cobra robs Fort Knox of its precious gold right under the noses of the Joes. They then try to flee in a serpentine bullet train, with the Joes in hot pursuit!- Cobra Sound Waves: Destro has an ultrasonic weapon in the Middle East, and Cobra Commander enlists his help to try to destroy a 3rd of the world's oil supply.- The Viper Is Coming: In the conflict between G.I. Joe and Cobra, a new 3rd party emerges! Who exactly is the Viper? Has to be seen to be believed!- Captives Of Cobra, 2-parts: The Joes and Cobra face off over the power of explosive, growing energy crystals. Cobra captures & brainwashes Joe family members in the conflict.... And really, I like this entire collection. Season 1.1 and Season 1.2 really go great together!

reviewText: I should start off with a warning, sometimes the way we remember things are better than they actually are. That can be said for GI Joe. The stories are campy, the artwork decent but nothing special and the dialog runs the gamut of witty and pathetic. All that said I am a GI Joe fan and I am glad to see these released on DVD. The nostalgia for me is better than the memory of waking up early to watch them before school. Don't expect art, expect a cartoon made for 10 year olds, but with a message of patriotism and doing good. I love GI Joe for what they are and I was thrilled with the DVDs. The quality is good and the packaging is high quality. The season also contains some very complex story lines if you read into them, I notice stuff now that I never did as a ten year old sitting on a couch. If you are a real fan you have already ordered these. If you are sitting on the fence its worth it to indulge. Now you know, and knowing is half the battle.

reviewText: In 1.2 of the G.I. Joe saga,the conflict goes up another level with these classic episodes. I saw some of these when I was very young and still love them today. If you buy one volume, you'll be compelled to buy the entire series like I have. The animation, while primative compared to today's serves it's purpose and is very entertaining. All the characters and my favorite,the Jack Nicholson inspired Ship Wreck are all here.  When I first saw these back in the 80's I never thought they could get away with the laser guns and the punching out the forces of Cobra. Syndication five days a week saved the company a lot of hassles with Saturday morning standards and practices. You would have never seen this on Saturday morning in the 1970's.  It's too bad this company couldn't go on to a season three. Another company took over for series two (not by Sunbow and Marvel) and the quality of these cartoons are vastly superior.
summary: Series ramps up to another level
